page.title: 08HOUSING IN GILMERTON
page.content: Gilmerton village can be divided up into the old village, which dates from the early ninteenth century, and the new housing estate built on council land within the last fifteen years. Building within the village was restricted for a long time by sewage problems in the nearby town of Crieff. However the council land ajoining the A85 proved an excellent site for the construction of the new estate so that now there approximately 3 new houses for every old dwelling. The village has very few services, the one shop serves the small population of about 280 people as a post office, newsagent and grocery. For the young there is a small youth club run in the old church.
